The Leonard Hotel - Marble Arch
8.3 Excellent
Based on 287 reviews

I went to London this trip with my wife and stayed in Leonard hotel for four nights. My wife love to shopping so we decided to stay in this hotel that is not disappointed at all.

The hotel just few mins walking to Oxford shopping street and the tube station. Many restaurants around that area. Hotel is nice but bid old with Victorian style. We can hear the room next door talking for the whole nite. The service is very poor and not up to four star hotel standard. We hv long flight for more than 13 hours fn Bangkok to London. We hv arrive hotel at 0700 hrs in the morning and really need to check in for resting. But we can not check in until 1100 hrs. Once we hv check in we are so tried and direct to bed for sleep. Appox one hour after our sleep, we go call from the front desk to inform that they need our credit card deposit but they forgot to ask us when we was checked in. I told them that I am so tried and need to sleep, I will bring down immediately once I got up.It seem that they are understanding our requested. But the next hour, they send the the person to come up to my room and open my room door with their key while I am sleeping to ask for the credit card deposit. I told him that I am sleeping and will bring the card down immediately after wake up. So, I continue my sleeping, but they called us again few hours later for the card that I was so upset. So I immediately went down and gave the card to them. It is very unacceptably manner for the staff in this hotel to walk in to thir room n wake then up 3 time in few hours. Further more, I was in Leonard hotel for 4 days and the elevator was broken for 2 days. I will not be back to this hotel again.

Show more
Apichart , Thailand
Corus Hotel Hyde Park
7.7 Very good
Based on 1103 reviews

We did not get the room we paid for even though I booked the rooms last year (Sept. 2016) and paid extra because their so called executive family room is not for a family of 4.

It's just for two people. We got two separate rooms. The rooms were clean but in need of updating. My husband and I shared a room with each child as they are not old enough to be alone. The room they got smelled unpleasant . We did not have any of the upgraded amenities written in their website (bathrobes, chocolate truffles, slippers, tea & coffee making facilities with complimentary Tchibo coffee espresso machine, hot chocolate & biscuits, in room mini-bar with complimentary refreshments & fresh milk). No mini-fridge. We got a call saying there is no extra fridge available and we can have a bucket of ice instead. The receptionist said she read my email to Agoda but did not get compensated and made us instead feel that we should be grateful we got 2 rooms instead. Not optimal for a family w/ 2 small children!

Show more
Marie , Norway
The Cumberland – A Marble Arch Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 1483 reviews

I was expecting more of this hotel. The room photos shown did not match with what we get, its a very small room for a price we paid for.

We arrived quite late around 11pm , no staff was helping us or offering us any hand to get our luggage to our room. For a 4 star hotel, I really think they can do better . The rooms smell terrible as well, they need a little maintenance on their furniture. The best thing that would make people come back to this hotel were the location of the hotel. This hotel is strategically located. They were just in front of the Marble Arch, right next to Marble Arch station and just minutes away from Oxford Street main areas. The only thing that will make me comeback to this hotel is the location of it. They do need to upgrade their service and their hotel standard!

Show more
Edwin , Indonesia
La Suite West – Hyde Park
8.2 Excellent
Based on 529 reviews

It's really a 1 min walk to bayswater station and maybe 3-4 minutes to queensway underground. So location wise, it is excellent plus there's heaps of eateries along the bayswater street.

On to the hotel, it's a small hotel and the rooms are also rather small but I was ready for that. The shower is excellent, strong water pressure and infinite hot water. I found the room to be rather stuffy at night though, even with the window down. Not sure what could be the problem. One big issue happened during my 9 day stay was that the housekeepers entered my room despite the Do not Disturb sign turned on. I left the room for lunch nearby and clearly left 1 key card in the slot so the DnD sign stays on. Came back an hour and half later to find my room cleaned and key card taken out of the slot. Nothing was missing but I had left a bit of money on the bed and some cheap jewellery still out on the table which was moved around. Wasn't best pleased with the incident.

Show more
Wan , Malaysia
St Giles London – A St Giles Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 1576 reviews

I have been to this hotel a few times now and have generally found the staff very friendly and efficient but the hotel is just OK! It is very well located close to a tube station and other popular sites.

However on this occasion my husband and I were very disappointed with the so called deluxe room, which had poorly fitting windows which icy cold wind blew through leaving us freezing despite the electric heater. Also the outside noise was unbearable and eventually at midnight we could tolerate no more of the cold and loud music nearby that we had to move to another room which was very basic. When we arrived the window was wide open obviously to mask the terrible smell of food which was ingrained into everything in the room including the bedding! We were so tired by this time that we eventually fell asleep. The breakfast which we had in the downstairs restaurant was an eye opener! Firstly my husband had to send the cutlery back because it was caked with the remainants of a previous guest's food. Secondly when the toast arrived in a basket I discovered the blister pack of a painkiller, possibly paracetamol, which someone had discarded and kitchen staff had unfortunately not noticed prior to placing the toast in the basket. Disgusting! When my breakfast came I was just queezy and unable to eat for thinking about the lack of cleanliness. Will I return, absolutely not!!

Show more
Bobbie , United Kingdom
Shangri-La Hotel At The Shard
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 142 reviews

We loved the hotel, the location couldn't have been better (just outside tube station as well), the view amazing and the attention to detail in terms of decorative finish is outstanding.

When it comes to good old fashioned customer service however, I felt it failed on a 5 star rating. Having had extensive conversations & confirmations prior to visit with the hotel, in particular with regards to children and if there were specific hours they were allowed to use the pool we were told they were welcome to use it and that the pool was open between 6 am and 8 pm. Upon arrival, however, they were only allowed to use this between restricted family hours. Not a problem, just don't like being told one thing and then something else upon arrival. In particular since my husband is unwell and we knew we would be spending more time than normal in the hotel. We stayed two nights and after the first night, they forgot to clean our room which was annoying, although this would usually not be a problem, but my husband had overdone it in the day and desperately needed a rest (again, importance of everything being as smooth as possible was clearly outlined in earlier conversation with hotel) and the added stress to him and myself was unnecessary in terms of getting the room done. In particular since I couldn't get hold of anyone over the phone, but had to take the lift down to the reception to query in person. Other minor details include things like no turn down service in the evening which I would have expected and upon checking out, we weren't even asked how our stay was which again, with such a lovely hotel, little things makes a difference and paying premium prices to me should give you an overall premium experience which I felt we didn't have. Shame, but that said, the hotel itself was so lovely and I would probably go back.

Show more
Caterine , Sweden
The Z Hotel Piccadilly
8.6 Excellent
Based on 444 reviews

I stayed at the Z Hotel for 2 nights during a recent business trip. My office was in regents park, so a short 5 min walk away.

The staff were incredibly polite, helpful and courteous. I arrived at 11:00pm at night & they informed me that I missed happy hour that day, but gave me a complimentary glass of wine to take to my room which was a nice touch. The breakfast was great - incredibly fresh food and good variety for the price. The café was really lovely too and a great place to relax. Rooms are very compact, but so cleverly designed - not a space wasted. My room was right near reception & the café, but was super quiet. Great place to stay for a few nights, or longer if you just want a friendly, clean and comfortable place to lay your head. Highly recommend.

Show more
Natalie , Australia
Central Park Hotel
6.9 Good
Based on 744 reviews

I went with a group of 18 people and booked this hotel on the internet. I booked a twin bed room and the photo shown a big twin room with two bed.

On the actual day, most of us were given a small room with a single bed and an add-on bed. The staff told us that was a twin room with 2 bed, but some of my friend got the twin bed as shown in the internet. Due to the large group of people and lack of twin bed room, they convert a single bed room to a twin bed room. Due to the room was hot with no air condition and ventilations and the window cannot be fully open, we requested a fan at 9pm, it took the staff to search the whole hotel and sent a spoilt fan, after that he never get back to us. when I saw the same staff on the next day, then he told me that there were not enough fan to give us as they had ran out of fan. This is the first time I am sweating and slept in the hotel room with the outside temperature of 18 degree Celsius.

Show more
chi , Singapore
Ace Hotel London Shoreditch
8.5 Excellent
Based on 294 reviews

It was hopsens choice, there was no other option we lift with , price was not refundable. As was very disturbing every morning they use to knock on the door disturbing our sleep and they open the room door luckily we were outing the chain lock and this was to tell us they need to clean the room or to check if it done.

Where they could put in each room card with 2 color red green for cleaning or not disturbing as 5 stare hotel Towels they smell very bad sometimes we dought if it was really washed and changed ? The we selected was for 4 adults but the space was not enough for 3 suit , the cabinet was big enough for 1 person , furnature decoration cheap industrial type , tea bags & coffees bags hold in office clips , 1 small table + 1 chair for room rented for 4 adult Honest is very rear to find ! They do lot of trikes with photos to sell you the room . Does this make you do more profit Certainly you lost my trust .

Show more
HUSSAIN , Qatar
Strand Palace Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 918 reviews

Booked an executive Kingsize room. Asked for a room away from the Strand, as we wanted peace and quiet.

The guy at the front desk (Adam) was extremely helpful and approachable. The room was lovely and quiet, although there was no view from the window - I didn't care as I didn't want any noise. I would imagine that the rooms towards the top of the hotel would be very hot without air-conditioning, so I would suggest checking that you have that in your room. It was a little strange upon entering the building, as there were no staff present at the front doors and we had to find our own way round to Reception - fair enough in a 3-star hotel, but you would expect a person to be on the door all the time at a 4 star. Perhaps they all got called away when we arrived and it was just a co-incidence. Generally though, a great stay and I would recommend it.

Show more
Emma , United Kingdom
The Z Hotel Victoria
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1381 reviews

The hotel is right next to London Victoria station so it's very convenient to reach other parts of London.

I was travelling out of Victoria to the South and staying near Victoria station made it simple and relaxing. The hotel has everything you would expect from a business hotel and is fronted by a cafe which also houses the reception. Staff were polite and helpful. There is a daily cheese and wine evening from 5 - 8pm for guests but I never had a chance to join in because of my arrangements. I stayed in room 212 which overlooked Lower Belgrave Street, so it was a bit awkward getting ready in the mornings with the office opposite and pedestrians able to see me through the window. I was upgraded from a windowless inner room when I checked in. The shower and toilet are separated by glass partitions that help to make the room look more spacious and the flooring is a rubberised vinyl type material which was used for the whole room. A pair of slippers would have been nice in this case. The double bed was very comfortable and was set up for two even though I booked for one. That was nice. The desk and chair were fine and there was drinking water provided. Having the London terminal next door meant that most things were easily available with Boots and newsagents all located within the station. There's a pub next door and a wine/off licence across the road. There are numerous cafe chains dotted around if thehotel's offerings do not meet your requirements. But the wifi and cosiness of the hotel cafe meant a lot of guests used it over going to other cafes. Overall, I would recommend this hotel even though the 20% hotel tax was a bit of a shock when I went to book. It took the £65 per night up to £80. If you will be travelling into London from Victoria then it is even more highly recommended.

Show more
Kevin , United Kingdom
Royal Garden Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 266 reviews

everything was great - newly refurbished hotel so don't be fooled from older reviews which reflect old hotel.

i asked for a quiet room as i saw some reviews about a noise problem near busy road at the front. they obliged and the room was lovely with a small raised area with sofa and desk. beautiful bathroom too. all excellent. the only complaint was the doorman on day one who offered to park the car in the multi-storey adjacent to the hotel. i said yes and 2 hours later when i asked for the car he explained he had elected to 'buy' on my behalf a 3 day ticket there. as it was friday pm i knew i only wanted 24 hours so that from sat pm i could park on the road outside for free til monday am. he said it would be difficult for him to change it as the charge was already addedc to my room. he politely said that i could have mentioned that i only wanted 24 hours... i replied that he could have asked!!! anyhow he did arrange for the charge to be refunded so all's well that ends well but it was a bit odd that he didn't ask. i had assumed that when i took it out the charge would be then be calculated. however this was the only negative for the whole stay of 3 nights.

Show more
Robert , United Kingdom
Sanctum Soho Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 175 reviews

This is a pleasant hotel right in the heart of London, so great for sightseeing and going out. I am glad I got a good deal as I would have been a bit annoyed if I'd paid more than £123 for the room we had.

It was fine, nicely decorated and functional, but the shower was terrible - a bit rainforest one that just dribbled water everywhere - not what I'd expect. When we arrived, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was small, but fine for one night. The bed was not the most comfortable, felt like I was tilted towards the headboard. There were some exposed pipes by the door as we arrive as if some maintenance was being done, but this was put right (they put a panel on the wall back) and our room tidied once we told reception. I would recommend this hotel, but to say it's five star, compared to somewhere like The Langham or Savoy is not truthful. It's a great base though for exploring and I would say the staff were all lovely.

Show more
Susan , United Kingdom
Amba Hotel Marble Arch
8 Very good
Based on 669 reviews

For the most part, the stay was alright. The rooms are newly renovated, bathrooms are very clean, beds were very comfortable.

We got in late so we ordered room service and the food was surprisingly good. The down side is, the hotel is very much understaffed. A lot of tour groups stay at this hotel and so, porterage/bell service was a disaster. Bags took hours to find, and there seemed to be 2 guys for over 100 guests. Reception was also challenged, too many people trying to get in and out at the same time. If you don't mind, take care of your bags yourself it will save you a lot of trouble, also pre-pay your rooms so you wont need to line up behind a lot of other guests.

Show more
Cristina , Philippines
The Athenaeum Hotel & Residences
8.5 Excellent
Based on 90 reviews

this is a fabulous hotel, i stayed here for 4 nights and i will definitely return to this hotel the next time i'm in london! (it's on the same road as the ritz) love the free wifi and there is a nespresso machine in the room as well.

to top things up, everything in the snacks bar (except for alcohol) is free. although i have to admit that the size of the room are pretty compact. after opening 1 luggage, there is barely any space left to walk around the room. that said, i still throughly enjoyed my stay in this hotel. the concierge is very helpful and provided dinner options/ reservations on 2 of the nights i was there. service with a personalised touch :)

Show more
Samantha , Singapore
Park Plaza Westminster Bridge Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 446 reviews

Having chosen your hotel mainly for location the 4* should have made it beyond satisfying, but failed miserably in making it anything more than an ideal location.

After the15-20min wait to check-in it's fair to say our patience was starting to wear thin. Once in the dark alcove that was our room we were again disappointed, fit for purpose only if I had migraine. Later that day with a tired baby in Co we retired for an early night, which presented another problem, the cot still hadn't been delivered. After a quick call all seem solved. With the little one asleep we proceded to order supper, & what an ordeal that was! I've had easier experiences completing mortgage paperwork than the disastrous structure that presented itself to simply order some room service. After approximately 25 minutes and far too many trips in the lift we finally achieved our goal & placed our order. Our food was delivered with no complaints there & we signed the bill to the room, fooled into believing that the stress of attempting to organise dinner had come to an end with a rude awakening around 10:38pm by the phone ringing. Now ... knowing we have a baby in the room one would like to believe some form of etiquette would be in place refrencing contact of any form to a reasonable hour (say before 9pm) but Oh No the Phone started ringing again...by this point I'm really questioning my treat weekend in your 4*Hotel instead of a No Frills stay in the Premier Inn across the road...atleast they deliver on expectations. The receotionist had called to alert us that we have no credit against our room & we needed to go down to make payment for the food, They were advised we had a baby & would deal with in the morning.The call was then followed up by knocking on the door & we noticed a letter the following morning explaining reqmnt of payment ref room service, trying to express the drama & stress to the receptionist the following day fell on deaf ears. Overall disappointingly unimpressed! :(

Show more
Stephanie , United Kingdom
Point A Hotel London Kings Cross - St. Pancras
7.6 Very good
Based on 1390 reviews

We arrive quite early in morning so we requested for an early check-in with a surcharge of £15.00/room with availability from 10am.

Luggage storage is also charged at £3.00/pc. It's quite surprising for us, but well it's London, everything is pricey. So we took the offer for early check-in instead, since we also had 5 luggage. We came back late that day and have to wait awhile to get 2nd rooms because the staff was not sure which rooms were assigned for us, he offered us a drink during waiting but we were too tired and we just wanted to rest. We received the rooms at the end, but it was not a twin, so we had to come to reception to change again, the new room were covered with dust underneath the bed. Housekeeping certainly did not do a very good job here. We stayed for 4 nights, and the hotel staff told us that our rooms were not supposed to clean every day but it will be clean at 2nd day. It was not cleaned until I talked to reception staff on the 3rd day to get it cleaned up. The stay should be better if these little details were taken care by the hotel. Hotel is walking distance to train station, there are few small store offer food.

Show more
BAO , Vietnam
Point A Hotel London Shoreditch
8.5 Excellent
Based on 133 reviews

Checked in on Saturday and most of the shops were closed. It was quite a happening street during weekdays though.

Hotel is near to Old Street station and Liverpool Street station, 15 minutes of walking distance. There are a couple of Boris bike station around shoreditch as well. You can actually walk all the way to the Tower Bridge. Room size is quite small, thankfully I only travelled with a sling bag, however my partner travelled with a big luggage and we took out all of his clothes lay it on the bedside shelf and his luggage kept under the bed. What a sight to behold... Also, the hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Full marks for them. Now, for the bad; The hotel from the outside is an ugly relic from the 70's. In fact another guest told me that it was voted 2nd ugliest building in London in a recent poll. I believe him. From the inside it is slightly better. Beds were comfortable, but nothing outstanding. I was quite disappointed until I pulled aside the curtain and stood amazed at the breathtaking view of the river. The buffet breakfast was nothing special either. Neither was dinner at the ground floor brasserie. But with so many great places to eat around the hotel, I didn't mind. Would I stay at this hotel again? Sure I would. The view alone is worth the trip.

Like other reviewers, the room I chose was very small. And, I chose one without windows (I like the almost complete darkness for sleeping!). However, given that my intention was to spend my two days in London touring, visiting museum, and catching a show or two, size was not important to me. The bed and linens were so comfortable and I slept soundly...the perfect antidote to jet lag and touring fatigue. One of the really special aspects of staying at the Z Hotel Soho was the free wine, cheese, crackers, fruits and nuts, offered to hotel guests between 5pm and 8pm. Being somewhat social, I found the cafe staff to be among the most friendly I can recall in recent years. The warmth and hospitality of the staff at reception and in the cafe will be the primary reason -- even over location and comfort -- that will bring me back to the Z Hotel Soho on future visits to London.

Inverness is not a terribly busy street, but you could hear everything on the street from jovial drinkers to people whispering as they passed the building. We have stayed twice at the So Park Apartments. The first time, we really liked the hotel and service.

Unfortunately, a mistake was made with our booking. There were also a few other smaller issues. However, we received exceptional service from David at the reception, who personally did everything possible to resolve issues and provide the best possible service. We were very impressed by this even though disappointed by the situation. The hotel management and other staff we dealt with did everything they could to make the situation better and we were satisfied with how they dealt with it. The second time we stayed, everything was great and trouble-free. Everything about the hotel is modern, stylish, and of a high standard. The rooms are large, comfortable, and have many facilities. No food is available, as it is entirely self-catering, but the rooms feature built-in kitchens with microwave, toaster, hobs, sink, refrigerator, and all items required for serving and eating food. The ensuite bathrooms are also very nice indeed, displaying a high level of style and quality. All staff were professional and courteous, whilst David stood out for his flawless service and great friendliness. Nothing was too much trouble for him in personally dealing with our issues and requests, so this made our stays very special. For us without a car, the location of the hotel in the Battersea area was not convenient for central London. Buses to Victoria Station frequently depart from outside the hotel (arriving back, the stop is Battersea Library, some distance before the hotel). However, it would be a lot more convenient if it were near an Underground Station to avoid the need to use both bus and Underground train for most places (slower and more costly). Battersea Park seems to be the only tourist feature nearby. We love the hotel and would really enjoy staying here again. Very highly recommended!

More about London

A stunning city of architectural and historic beauty as well as a vibrant arts scene, London is certainly a favorite destination for many world travelers. It's one of the world's most exciting capitals, and a great starting point for exploring the rest of Europe. London is served by five airports, with Heathrow Airport and Gatwick Airport being the most well-known travel hubs. Hotels near Gatwick Airport are convenient for quick stopovers in the city and considerably cheaper than hotels in central London. For travelers arriving via train, hotels in Bayswater and Paddington are plentiful and comparatively inexpensive.

Getting around central London is easy via the tube – a vast connection of subway lines that serve the inner city. When the weather permits, the walk between the most famous sites like Buckingham Palace and the Tower of London should not be missed.

London is home to beautiful architecture, as evidenced by buildings such as the Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey, and Tower Bridge.

Live music is a staple of the London lifestyle, with concerts and shows highlighting nearly every night of the week. London is one of the most recognizable destinations in all of the world, and a city that sets the standard for what it means to be an elegant metropolis.

There’s much more to see and learn about London, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

My wife love to shopping so we decided to stay in this hotel that is not disappointed at all. The hotel just few mins walking to Oxford shopping street and the tube station. Many restaurants around that area. Hotel is nice but bid old with Victorian style. We can hear the room next door talking for the whole nite. The service is very poor and not up to four star hotel standard. We hv long flight for more than 13 hours fn Bangkok to London. We hv arrive hotel at 0700 hrs in the morning and really need to check in for resting. But we can not check in until 1100 hrs. Once we hv check in we are so tried and direct to bed for sleep. Appox one hour after our sleep, we go call from the front desk to inform that they need our credit card deposit but they forgot to ask us when we was checked in. I told them that I am so tried and need to sleep, I will bring down immediately once I got up.It seem that they are understanding our requested. But the next hour, they send the the person to come up to my room and open my room door with their key while I am sleeping to ask for the credit card deposit. I told him that I am sleeping and will bring the card down immediately after wake up. So, I continue my sleeping, but they called us again few hours later for the card that I was so upset. So I immediately went down and gave the card to them. It is very unacceptably manner for the staff in this hotel to walk in to thir room n wake then up 3 time in few hours. Further more, I was in Leonard hotel for 4 days and the elevator was broken for 2 days. I will not be back to this hotel again. Show more Apichart , Thailand Corus Hotel Hyde Park 7.7 Very good Based on 1103 reviews We did not get the room we paid for even though I booked the rooms last year (Sept. 2016) and paid extra because their so called executive family room is not for a family of 4. It's just for two people. We got two separate rooms. The rooms were clean but in need of updating. My husband and I shared a room with each child as they are not old enough to be alone. The room they got smelled unpleasant . We did not have any of the upgraded amenities written in their website (bathrobes, chocolate truffles, slippers, tea & coffee making facilities with complimentary Tchibo coffee espresso machine, hot chocolate & biscuits, in room mini-bar with complimentary refreshments & fresh milk). No mini-fridge. We got a call saying there is no extra fridge available and we can have a bucket of ice instead. The receptionist said she read my email to Agoda but did not get compensated and made us instead feel that we should be grateful we got 2 rooms instead. Not optimal for a family w/ 2 small children! Show more Marie , Norway The Cumberland – A Marble Arch Hotel 8 Very good Based on 1483 reviews I was expecting more of this hotel. The room photos shown did not match with what we get, its a very small room for a price we paid for. We arrived quite late around 11pm , no staff was helping us or offering us any hand to get our luggage to our room. For a 4 star hotel, I really think they can do better . The rooms smell terrible as well, they need a little maintenance on their furniture. The best thing that would make people come back to this hotel were the location of the hotel. This hotel is strategically located. They were just in front of the Marble Arch, right next to Marble Arch station and just minutes away from Oxford Street main areas. The only thing that will make me comeback to this hotel is the location of it. They do need to upgrade their service and their hotel standard! Show more Edwin , Indonesia La Suite West – Hyde Park 8.2 Excellent Based on 529 reviews It's really a 1 min walk to bayswater station and maybe 3-4 minutes to queensway underground. So location wise, it is excellent plus there's heaps of eateries along the bayswater street. On to the hotel, it's a small hotel and the rooms are also rather small but I was ready for that. The shower is excellent, strong water pressure and infinite hot water. I found the room to be rather stuffy at night though, even with the window down. Not sure what could be the problem. One big issue happened during my 9 day stay was that the housekeepers entered my room despite the Do not Disturb sign turned on. I left the room for lunch nearby and clearly left 1 key card in the slot so the DnD sign stays on. Came back an hour and half later to find my room cleaned and key card taken out of the slot. Nothing was missing but I had left a bit of money on the bed and some cheap jewellery still out on the table which was moved around. Wasn't best pleased with the incident. Show more Wan , Malaysia St Giles London – A St Giles Hotel 7.6 Very good Based on 1576 reviews I have been to this hotel a few times now and have generally found the staff very friendly and efficient but the hotel is just OK! It is very well located close to a tube station and other popular sites. However on this occasion my husband and I were very disappointed with the so called deluxe room, which had poorly fitting windows which icy cold wind blew through leaving us freezing despite the electric heater. Also the outside noise was unbearable and eventually at midnight we could tolerate no more of the cold and loud music nearby that we had to move to another room which was very basic. When we arrived the window was wide open obviously to mask the terrible smell of food which was ingrained into everything in the room including the bedding! We were so tired by this time that we eventually fell asleep. The breakfast which we had in the downstairs restaurant was an eye opener! Firstly my husband had to send the cutlery back because it was caked with the remainants of a previous guest's food. Secondly when the toast arrived in a basket I discovered the blister pack of a painkiller, possibly paracetamol, which someone had discarded and kitchen staff had unfortunately not noticed prior to placing the toast in the basket. Disgusting! When my breakfast came I was just queezy and unable to eat for thinking about the lack of cleanliness. Will I return, absolutely not!! Show more Bobbie , United Kingdom Shangri-La Hotel At The Shard 9.1 Exceptional Based on 142 reviews We loved the hotel, the location couldn't have been better (just outside tube station as well), the view amazing and the attention to detail in terms of decorative finish is outstanding. When it comes to good old fashioned customer service however, I felt it failed on a 5 star rating. Having had extensive conversations & confirmations prior to visit with the hotel, in particular with regards to children and if there were specific hours they were allowed to use the pool we were told they were welcome to use it and that the pool was open between 6 am and 8 pm. Upon arrival, however, they were only allowed to use this between restricted family hours. Not a problem, just don't like being told one thing and then something else upon arrival. In particular since my husband is unwell and we knew we would be spending more time than normal in the hotel. We stayed two nights and after the first night, they forgot to clean our room which was annoying, although this would usually not be a problem, but my husband had overdone it in the day and desperately needed a rest (again, importance of everything being as smooth as possible was clearly outlined in earlier conversation with hotel) and the added stress to him and myself was unnecessary in terms of getting the room done. In particular since I couldn't get hold of anyone over the phone, but had to take the lift down to the reception to query in person. Other minor details include things like no turn down service in the evening which I would have expected and upon checking out, we weren't even asked how our stay was which again, with such a lovely hotel, little things makes a difference and paying premium prices to me should give you an overall premium experience which I felt we didn't have. Shame, but that said, the hotel itself was so lovely and I would probably go back. Show more Caterine , Sweden The Z Hotel Piccadilly 8.6 Excellent Based on 444 reviews I stayed at the Z Hotel for 2 nights during a recent business trip. The breakfast was great - incredibly fresh food and good variety for the price. The café was really lovely too and a great place to relax. Great place to stay for a few nights, or longer if you just want a friendly, clean and comfortable place to lay your head. Highly recommend. This is the first time I am sweating and slept in the hotel room with the outside temperature of 18 degree Celsius. Show more HUSSAIN , Qatar Strand Palace Hotel 8 Very good Based on 918 reviews Booked an executive Kingsize room. Asked for a room away from the Strand, as we wanted peace and quiet. The guy at the front desk (Adam) was extremely helpful and approachable. The room was lovely and quiet, although there was no view from the window - I didn't care as I didn't want any noise. I would imagine that the rooms towards the top of the hotel would be very hot without air-conditioning, so I would suggest checking that you have that in your room. It was a little strange upon entering the building, as there were no staff present at the front doors and we had to find our own way round to Reception - fair enough in a 3-star hotel, but you would expect a person to be on the door all the time at a 4 star. Perhaps they all got called away when we arrived and it was just a co-incidence. Generally though, a great stay and I would recommend it. Show more Emma , United Kingdom The Z Hotel Victoria 8.1 Excellent Based on 1381 reviews The hotel is right next to London Victoria station so it's very convenient to reach other parts of London. I was travelling out of Victoria to the South and staying near Victoria station made it simple and relaxing. The hotel has everything you would expect from a business hotel and is fronted by a cafe which also houses the reception. Staff were polite and helpful. There is a daily cheese and wine evening from 5 - 8pm for guests but I never had a chance to join in because of my arrangements. I stayed in room 212 which overlooked Lower Belgrave Street, so it was a bit awkward getting ready in the mornings with the office opposite and pedestrians able to see me through the window. I was upgraded from a windowless inner room when I checked in. The shower and toilet are separated by glass partitions that help to make the room look more spacious and the flooring is a rubberised vinyl type material which was used for the whole room. A pair of slippers would have been nice in this case. The double bed was very comfortable and was set up for two even though I booked for one. That was nice. The desk and chair were fine and there was drinking water provided. Having the London terminal next door meant that most things were easily available with Boots and newsagents all located within the station. There's a pub next door and a wine/off licence across the road. There are numerous cafe chains dotted around if thehotel's offerings do not meet your requirements. But the wifi and cosiness of the hotel cafe meant a lot of guests used it over going to other cafes. Overall, I would recommend this hotel even though the 20% hotel tax was a bit of a shock when I went to book. It took the £65 per night up to £80. If you will be travelling into London from Victoria then it is even more highly recommended. Show more Kevin , United Kingdom Royal Garden Hotel 8.4 Excellent Based on 266 reviews everything was great - newly refurbished hotel so don't be fooled from older reviews which reflect old hotel. i asked for a quiet room as i saw some reviews about a noise problem near busy road at the front. they obliged and the room was lovely with a small raised area with sofa and desk. beautiful bathroom too. all excellent. the only complaint was the doorman on day one who offered to park the car in the multi-storey adjacent to the hotel. i said yes and 2 hours later when i asked for the car he explained he had elected to 'buy' on my behalf a 3 day ticket there. as it was friday pm i knew i only wanted 24 hours so that from sat pm i could park on the road outside for free til monday am. he said it would be difficult for him to change it as the charge was already addedc to my room. he politely said that i could have mentioned that i only wanted 24 hours... i replied that he could have asked!!! anyhow he did arrange for the charge to be refunded so all's well that ends well but it was a bit odd that he didn't ask. i had assumed that when i took it out the charge would be then be calculated. however this was the only negative for the whole stay of 3 nights. Show more Robert , United Kingdom Sanctum Soho Hotel 8.2 Excellent Based on 175 reviews This is a pleasant hotel right in the heart of London, so great for sightseeing and going out. I am glad I got a good deal as I would have been a bit annoyed if I'd paid more than £123 for the room we had. It was fine, nicely decorated and functional, but the shower was terrible - a bit rainforest one that just dribbled water everywhere - not what I'd expect. When we arrived, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was small, but fine for one night. The bed was not the most comfortable, felt like I was tilted towards the headboard. There were some exposed pipes by the door as we arrive as if some maintenance was being done, but this was put right (they put a panel on the wall back) and our room tidied once we told reception. I would recommend this hotel, but to say it's five star, compared to somewhere like The Langham or Savoy is not truthful. It's a great base though for exploring and I would say the staff were all lovely. Show more Susan , United Kingdom Amba Hotel Marble Arch 8 Very good Based on 669 reviews For the most part, the stay was alright. The rooms are newly renovated, bathrooms are very clean, beds were very comfortable. We got in late so we ordered room service and the food was surprisingly good. The down side is, the hotel is very much understaffed. A lot of tour groups stay at this hotel and so, porterage/bell service was a disaster. If you don't mind, take care of your bags yourself it will save you a lot of trouble, also pre-pay your rooms so you wont need to line up behind a lot of other guests. Show more Cristina , Philippines The Athenaeum Hotel & Residences 8.5 Excellent Based on 90 reviews this is a fabulous hotel, i stayed here for 4 nights and i will definitely return to this hotel the next time i'm in london! (it's on the same road as the ritz) love the free wifi and there is a nespresso machine in the room as well. to top things up, everything in the snacks bar (except for alcohol) is free. although i have to admit that the size of the room are pretty compact. after opening 1 luggage, there is barely any space left to walk around the room. that said, i still throughly enjoyed my stay in this hotel. the concierge is very helpful and provided dinner options/ reservations on 2 of the nights i was there. service with a personalised touch :) Show more Samantha , Singapore Park Plaza Westminster Bridge Hotel 8.2 Excellent Based on 446 reviews Having chosen your hotel mainly for location the 4* should have made it beyond satisfying, but failed miserably in making it anything more than an ideal location. After the15-20min wait to check-in it's fair to say our patience was starting to wear thin. Once in the dark alcove that was our room we were again disappointed, fit for purpose only if I had migraine. Later that day with a tired baby in Co we retired for an early night, which presented another problem, the cot still hadn't been delivered. After a quick call all seem solved. With the little one asleep we proceded to order supper, & what an ordeal that was! I've had easier experiences completing mortgage paperwork than the disastrous structure that presented itself to simply order some room service. After approximately 25 minutes and far too many trips in the lift we finally achieved our goal & placed our order. Our food was delivered with no complaints there & we signed the bill to the room, fooled into believing that the stress of attempting to organise dinner had come to an end with a rude awakening around 10:38pm by the phone ringing. Now ... knowing we have a baby in the room one would like to believe some form of etiquette would be in place refrencing contact of any form to a reasonable hour (say before 9pm) but Oh No the Phone started ringing again...by this point I'm really questioning my treat weekend in your 4*Hotel instead of a No Frills stay in the Premier Inn across the road...atleast they deliver on expectations. The receotionist had called to alert us that we have no credit against our room & we needed to go down to make payment for the food, They were advised we had a baby & would deal with in the morning.The call was then followed up by knocking on the door & we noticed a letter the following morning explaining reqmnt of payment ref room service, trying to express the drama & stress to the receptionist the following day fell on deaf ears. Overall disappointingly unimpressed! :( Show more Stephanie , United Kingdom Point A Hotel London Kings Cross - St. Pancras 7.6 Very good Based on 1390 reviews We arrive quite early in morning so we requested for an early check-in with a surcharge of £15.00/room with availability from 10am. Luggage storage is also charged at £3.00/pc. It's quite surprising for us, but well it's London, everything is pricey. So we took the offer for early check-in instead, since we also had 5 luggage. We came back late that day and have to wait awhile to get 2nd rooms because the staff was not sure which rooms were assigned for us, he offered us a drink during waiting but we were too tired and we just wanted to rest. We received the rooms at the end, but it was not a twin, so we had to come to reception to change again, the new room were covered with dust underneath the bed. Housekeeping certainly did not do a very good job here. We stayed for 4 nights, and the hotel staff told us that our rooms were not supposed to clean every day but it will be clean at 2nd day. It was not cleaned until I talked to reception staff on the 3rd day to get it cleaned up. The stay should be better if these little details were taken care by the hotel. Hotel is walking distance to train station, there are few small store offer food. Show more BAO , Vietnam Point A Hotel London Shoreditch 8.5 Excellent Based on 133 reviews Checked in on Saturday and most of the shops were closed. It was quite a happening street during weekdays though. Hotel is near to Old Street station and Liverpool Street station, 15 minutes of walking distance. There are a couple of Boris bike station around shoreditch as well. You can actually walk all the way to the Tower Bridge. Room size is quite small, thankfully I only travelled with a sling bag, however my partner travelled with a big luggage and we took out all of his clothes lay it on the bedside shelf and his luggage kept under the bed. No housekeeping during our 3 days stay, I don't know whether I should request it daily, didn't bother to ask. All in all, with the location and ensuite bathroom, it is okay Show more Nur , Malaysia The Tower Hotel 8.4 Excellent Based on 484 reviews Let me start with the good. The location: outstanding! I had a room directly overlooking the tower bridge. It was absolutely stunning. Walk out of the hotel, and there are more great shops and restaurant within a 3 mile radius than you could shake a stick at. The nearest underground station is a few minutes walk away. And of course, there's the nearby Tower of London. Even if you are travelling on business like I was, don't skip the visit. What a sight to behold... Also, the hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Full marks for them. Now, for the bad; The hotel from the outside is an ugly relic from the 70's. In fact another guest told me that it was voted 2nd ugliest building in London in a recent poll. I believe him. From the inside it is slightly better. The rooms were dilapidated and looked like they had not been refurbished in a couple of decades. Cabinets and drawers with chipped surfaces and missing handles etc... Beds were comfortable, but nothing outstanding. I was quite disappointed until I pulled aside the curtain and stood amazed at the breathtaking view of the river. The buffet breakfast was nothing special either. Neither was dinner at the ground floor brasserie. But with so many great places to eat around the hotel, I didn't mind. Would I stay at this hotel again? Sure I would. The view alone is worth the trip. Show more Abdulaziz , Saudi Arabia Best Western Maitrise Hotel Maida Vale 7.6 Very good Based on 331 reviews I travelled to London on business and I made the booking almost 2 months before travelling, which my company paid in full at the time of booking. However, when I arrived, I was told that I need to pay £50 deposit for this. I told them that I had already paid in full, but they insisted I need to pay this in addition to the full payment already done. No-one bothered to tell me this in the two months leading up to the booking, otherwise I would have arranged this through my company - this caused great inconvenience to me and had to go out of pocket myself - and this hasn't been returned to me as yet, despite it being only an overnight stay, I was told it would take 3-4 days before it would be back in my bank account again!! They also insisted on me presenting ID, which was not told beforehand. Shocking! In addition to this, the room was dark, with half the lights not working, the bed was uncomfortable and you couldn't open the windows - the air conditioning didn't work, so it was very hot, stifling and felt extremely claustrophobic. I hardly slept a wink as the corridor creaked every time someone walked down, plus could hear thumping and banging from the floor above throughout the night and early morning. All in all, a horrid experience, felt more like being in a prison than a hotel, and customers get treated like criminals! Show more Paul , United Kingdom The Z Hotel Soho 8 Very good Based on 483 reviews I arrived quite early in the morning at the Z Hotel Soho after a long, overnight flight from Shanghai to London. One room is a full living area with pull out sofa bed, dining table and kitchenette. The other room is a bedroom. There are also 2 bathrooms. The rooms seem recently renovated, so they are pretty clean. The only downside is the walls are a bit thin, but I think that's a common problem with these converted Victorians. The TV wasn't working properly. We complained to the front desk, and the guy came to take a look. He fiddled around a bit, then decided that's the best it could be. It was obviously getting a bad analog signal, not the digital TV they promised. The second night I complained to another staff member, and he was able to remedy the situation, so we did end up with good DTV. There was no DVD player as advertised, but I never complained about this since I had nothing to watch anyway. The Wifi was another sore spot. On the one hand, the wifi was complimentary, which is much better than most of the hotels in the area. We did have problems getting connected at times. I think the entire neighborhood knows their password and uses their network. We didn't make full use of the kitc Show more Edward , United States Go Native Monument Apartments 8.4 Excellent Based on 52 reviews Its a bad idea to choose Go Native, as they will screw up your trip. They refuse to upgrade and keep the same type of room. Their attitude is kind of asking you to accept the changes or they just fully refund to you. I booked the trip in Early April for June and they can spoil your trip few days before your arrival when you are getting exited for the trip. You have to spend the time of your trip after arrival to negotiate with them. If you don't mind they move you to other branches whenever they like, you may choose Go Native, but if you have planned everything, find another one. Don't let go native spoil your trip. Easy to get to the different areas of interest and 2 minute walk to the underground. Great neighborhood, as well with local deli's and cafe's. Staff was friendly for intake and checking out. Size was on point with the posting. Cons: Not clean. This was a big one for us. We were shocked that the walls, floor, and "curtains" had sauce and other stains on them. There were also bugs in the room and hallway. The sheets had been washed (we think), but there were still body and other hairs from previous use. We stayed in what I'd call an efficiency. Perfect size, actually, for just dropping bags, sleeping, and cleaning up before a night out. However, it did not even closely resemble the pictures -- a baseline picture for all room types should really be on display, not just the premium suite(s). Several lights didn't work and the TV didn't work. The "bed" was on the floor, and combined with the other issue above, I woke up twice with ants on me. We live in a European university town, so we are very familiar with the vibrant hum of nightlife. Inverness is not a terribly busy street, but you could hear everything on the street from jovial drinkers to people whispering as they passed the building. We even checked to see if the window was open, but poor maintenance (caulk, seals, etc) seems to be the culprit. We also didn't have hot water in the morning. We got up between 0600 and 0700 each morning, and even waited until 0800 to see if we could get any warmth at all. We complained about this after assuming the first day was a one-off. 4 days, no hot water in the morning. The staff sent up someone to have a look, but it was never fixed, unfortunately. Overall, you get a private shower but this room was below average for even hostels we've stayed in while traveling on a budget. We are certain other rooms in the Hyde Park Superior Apts. are great given the ratings, but we did not have the good fortune to experience one. I met the manager on duty to inform him on my mobile which I left in the room. The manager said he will checked and came back within 5 minutes. He informed us that the cleaner did not see the mobile and we could have left it somewhere. He further said that he trusted his staff and it is unlikely that the cleaner could have taken it. He disallowed us to speak to the cleaner or for us to go back to our room to check. I got my sister to call my mobile again and this time the phone had been switched off. It is your guess who could have possession of my mobile. This gives me the impression that the manager on duty lacks the credibility and skills in addressing the problems faced by the hotel guests. This also means taking things left behind by hotel guests is acceptable and condone by him. His professionalism in the hospitality industry is questionable here. Incidence such as this is good enough to give a bad name to the hotel, jeopardizing its branding that had been built over the years. Unfortunately the Manager on duty do not see it this way. We were very impressed by this even though disappointed by the situation. The hotel management and other staff we dealt with did everything they could to make the situation better and we were satisfied with how they dealt with it. The second time we stayed, everything was great and trouble-free. Everything about the hotel is modern, stylish, and of a high standard. The rooms are large, comfortable, and have many facilities. No food is available, as it is entirely self-catering, but the rooms feature built-in kitchens with microwave, toaster, hobs, sink, refrigerator, and all items required for serving and eating food. The ensuite bathrooms are also very nice indeed, displaying a high level of style and quality. All staff were professional and courteous, whilst David stood out for his flawless service and great friendliness. Nothing was too much trouble for him in personally dealing with our issues and requests, so this made our stays very special. For us without a car, the location of the hotel in the Battersea area was not convenient for central London. Buses to Victoria Station frequently depart from outside the hotel (arriving back, the stop is Battersea Library, some distance before the hotel). However, it would be a lot more convenient if it were near an Underground Station to avoid the need to use both bus and Underground train for most places (slower and more costly). Battersea Park seems to be the only tourist feature nearby. We love the hotel and would really enjoy staying here again. Very highly recommended! Show more Rezek ,Slovenia beautiful cities, with lots of activity to be done such as sight seeing, trying new food, shopping and relaxing by the park and coffee place ROSLLY ,Malaysia Discover the neighborhoods of London Chelsea 1363 hotels Hyde Park 1293 hotels Kings Cross St. Pancras 777 hotels Lambeth 619 hotels Waterloo and Southwark 602 hotels The City 554 hotels Tower Hamlets 539 hotels Canary Wharf 526 hotels Bloomsbury 474 hotels Camden 455 hotels Marylebone 454 hotels Westminster 419 hotels Hammersmith 406 hotels West End Soho 358 hotels Earls Court 356 hotels Notting Hill 351 hotels Shoreditch 333 hotels Wandsworth 291 hotels Wembley 270 hotels Greater London North 260 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in London 6123 Guest Houses in London 594 Serviced Apartments in London 247 Hostels in London 126 Capsule Hotels in London 2 More about London A stunning city of architectural and historic beauty as well as a vibrant arts scene, London is certainly a favorite destination for many world travelers. It's one of the world's most exciting capitals, and a great starting point for exploring the rest of Europe. London is served by five airports, with Heathrow Airport and Gatwick Airport being the most well-known travel hubs. Hotels near Gatwick Airport are convenient for quick stopovers in the city and considerably cheaper than hotels in central London. For travelers arriving via train, hotels in Bayswater and Paddington are plentiful and comparatively inexpensive. Getting around central London is easy via the tube – a vast connection of subway lines that serve the inner city. When the weather permits, the walk between the most famous sites like Buckingham Palace and the Tower of London should not be missed. London is home to beautiful architecture, as evidenced by buildings such as the Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey , and Tower Bridge. Live music is a staple of the London lifestyle, with concerts and shows highlighting nearly every night of the week. London is one of the most recognizable destinations in all of the world, and a city that sets the standard for what it means to be an elegant metropolis. There’s much more to see and learn about London, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
